TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , whose particulars are set out in the appendix , are NORP nationals . They are the wife and children of PERSON , who disappeared in DATE . They were represented before the ORG by PERSON PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON , near GPE .
CARDINAL . s and as they appear from the documents submitted by them , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON and CARDINAL men were seen getting into a white car outside ORG shop in the town of ORG . Nothing has been heard from Mr Taşçı since DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE Mr ORG ’s son , PERSON , who is CARDINAL of the applicants , applied to ORG police headquarters and informed them of the disappearance of his father .

CARDINAL . Police officers subsequently questioned CARDINAL witnesses , CARDINAL of whom informed them that QUANTITY persons , fitting the description of the men who had taken Mr Taşçı away , had asked him for directions to Mr Taşçı ’s shop . The remaining QUANTITY witnesses told the police officers that they had seen Mr Taşçı getting into the car together with the QUANTITY persons .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG prosecutor took statements from a petrol station attendant who claimed that the CARDINAL persons had bought petrol for the white car in question and paid with a cheque . It was later established that the cheque belonged to a bank account of ORG ( hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) but that it had been given to the petrol station at an earlier date by CARDINAL of the QUANTITY persons who was seen together with PERSON on DATE of the incident .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG submitted a petition to the office of the ORG governor , and complained about the disappearance of his father . In his petition Mr ORG claimed that his family was worried about the fate of his father and that , in his opinion , his father had been abducted by members of the ORG . The governor forwarded the petition to the ORG police headquarters DATE .

CARDINAL . Further investigative steps were taken by the police and the prosecutor in DATE . During that investigation a number of other eyewitnesses confirmed having seen PERSON in a white car together with the CARDINAL persons who , it was later established , were members of the ORG . The Director of the ORG denied that his service had taken away PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG prosecutor issued a continuous search order for PERSON , and asked the police to give him progress reports DATE . Police officers complied with this instruction and gave progress reports to the prosecutor on a regular basis .

CARDINAL . DATE , the ORG prosecutor sought permission to prosecute CARDINAL ORG officers in relation to the abduction . In DATE CARDINAL permission was granted and the officers were questioned by the prosecutor . They all denied the accusations . On DATE the ORG prosecutor rendered a decision not to prosecute the CARDINAL ORG officers for lack of sufficient evidence .

CARDINAL . The police continued their search for PERSON and kept the prosecutor informed about their progress . No further information came to light about Mr Taşçı ’s fate . On DATE the investigation was closed due to the expiry of the statute of limitations . The applicant objected to the decision terminating the investigation , but that request was rejected by ORG on DATE .
